pageDescription: Actions for playing animations on bots.

summary.text:
Animates multiple tags on the given bot based on the specified parameters.

This works similarly to
[`animateTag(bot, tag, options)`](ref:animateTag-byTag)

but instead of providing a tag name, you instead provide an object for the fromValue and toValue options which contains the tags that should be animated.

Returns a promise that resolves when the animation is finished and throws an error when the animation is canceled. This is useful for gradually changing a set of tags on a bot over time. For example, moving a bot from point A to point B without teleporting it.

Unlike calling
[`animateTag(bot, tag, options)`](ref:animateTag-byTag)

multiple times, animations started with this function are grouped together. This means that canceling one animation in the group will also cancel the others.

This function is fully integrated with tag masks. This lets you animate tag values in the tempLocal, local, player, and shared spaces.
the bot, bot ID, or list of bots that the tag should be animated on.
the options that should be used to animate the tag. If null is used, then any active animations for the tag on these bots will be canceled.

comment.text:
Animates multiple tags on the given bot based on the specified parameters.

This works similarly to animateTag-byTag but instead of providing a tag name, you instead provide an object for the fromValue and toValue options which contains the tags that should be animated.

Returns a promise that resolves when the animation is finished and throws an error when the animation is canceled. This is useful for gradually changing a set of tags on a bot over time. For example, moving a bot from point A to point B without teleporting it.

Unlike calling animateTag-byTag multiple times, animations started with this function are grouped together. This means that canceling one animation in the group will also cancel the others.

This function is fully integrated with tag masks. This lets you animate tag values in the tempLocal, local, player, and shared spaces.

summary.text:
Animates the tag on the given bot based on the specified parameters.
Returns a promise that resolves when the animation is finished and throws an error when the animation is canceled.
This is useful for gradually changing a tag on a bot over time. For example, moving a bot from point A to point B without teleporting it.
[`animateTag(bot, tag, options)`](ref:animateTag-byTag)
is fully integrated with tag masks. This lets you animate tag values in the
`tempLocal`
`local`
`player`
, and
`shared`
spaces.
the bot, bot ID, or list of bots that the tag should be animated on.
the tag that should be animated.
the options that should be used to animate the tag. If null is used, then any active animations for the tag on these bots will be canceled.

comment.text:
Animates the tag on the given bot based on the specified parameters.
Returns a promise that resolves when the animation is finished and throws an error when the animation is canceled.
This is useful for gradually changing a tag on a bot over time. For example, moving a bot from point A to point B without teleporting it.

animateTag-byTag is fully integrated with tag masks. This lets you animate tag values in the `tempLocal`, `local`, `player`, and `shared` spaces.

summary.text:
Cancels the animations that are running on the given bot(s).
If a tag is specified then only animations for the given tag will be canceled.
the bot, bot ID, or list of bots that should cancel their animations.
the tag or list of tags that the animations should be canceled for.

comment.text:
Cancels the animations that are running on the given bot(s).
If a tag is specified then only animations for the given tag will be canceled.

summary.text:
Starts the given animation on the given bot or list of bots using the given options. Returns a promise that resolves once the animation(s) have been started.

Triggers the
[`@onFormAnimationStarted`](tags:@onFormAnimationStarted)
and
[`@onAnyFormAnimationStarted`](tags:@onAnyFormAnimationStarted)
listeners once the animation has started.

content.text:
```ts
Start the "Run" animation on this bot
await os.startFormAnimation(thisBot, "Run");
```

```ts
Start the "Run" animation on every bot in the home dimension
await os.startFormAnimation(getBots(inDimension("home")), "Run");
```
Actions for playing animations on bots.

summary.text: the bot or list of bots that the animation should be started on.
the name of the animation that should be started. Additionally, it can be the index number of the animation that should be played.
the options that should be used to play the animation.

comment.text:
Starts the given animation on the given bot or list of bots using the given options. Returns a promise that resolves once the animation(s) have been started.

Triggers the @onFormAnimationStarted and @onAnyFormAnimationStarted listeners once the animation has started.

tags.text:
```ts
Start the "Run" animation on this bot
await os.startFormAnimation(thisBot, "Run");
```

```ts
Start the "Run" animation on every bot in the home dimension
await os.startFormAnimation(getBots(inDimension("home")), "Run");
```
Actions for playing animations on bots.

summary.text:
Stops the animations that are running on the given bot or list of bots using the given options. Returns a promise that resolves once the animations have been stopped.

This function only works for animations that have been started by
[`os.startFormAnimation(botOrBots, nameOrIndex, options)`](ref:os.startFormAnimation)

.

Triggers the
[`@onFormAnimationStopped`](tags:@onFormAnimationStopped)
and
[`@onAnyFormAnimationStopped`](tags:@onAnyFormAnimationStopped)
listeners once the animation has stopped.

content.text:
```ts
Stop the animations on this bot
await os.stopFormAnimation(thisBot);
```

summary.text: the bot or list of bots whose animations should be stopped.
the options that should be used for stopping the animations.

comment.text:
Stops the animations that are running on the given bot or list of bots using the given options. Returns a promise that resolves once the animations have been stopped.

This function only works for animations that have been started by os.startFormAnimation.

Triggers the @onFormAnimationStopped and @onAnyFormAnimationStopped listeners once the animation has stopped.

tags.text:
```ts
Stop the animations on this bot
await os.stopFormAnimation(thisBot);
```

summary.text:
Retrieves the list of animations that are available on the given bot or GLTF mesh address.
Returns a promise that resolves with the list of available animations.

content.text:
```ts
Get the list of animations on this bot
const animations = await os.listFormAnimations(thisBot);
```

```ts
Get the list of animations for a specific address
const animations = await os.listFormAnimations('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/KhronosGroup/glTF-Sample-Models/master/2.0/Fox/glTF/Fox.gltf');
```

summary.text: the bot or address that the animation list should be retrieved from

comment.text:
Retrieves the list of animations that are available on the given bot or GLTF mesh address.
Returns a promise that resolves with the list of available animations.

tags.text:
```ts
Get the list of animations on this bot
const animations = await os.listFormAnimations(thisBot);
```

```ts
Get the list of animations for a specific address
const animations = await os.listFormAnimations('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/KhronosGroup/glTF-Sample-Models/master/2.0/Fox/glTF/Fox.gltf');
```

summary.text:
Pre-caches the given GLTF mesh address so that it will load instantly when used on a bot later.
Returns a promise that resolves once the address has been cached.
The address that should be cached.

comment.text:
Pre-caches the given GLTF mesh address so that it will load instantly when used on a bot later.
Returns a promise that resolves once the address has been cached.
